org.apache.mesos.config

Interface ConfigStore<T extends Configuration>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Configuration object to be serialized and deserialized in the implementation of this interface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CuratorConfigStore

    public interface ConfigStore<T extends Configuration>
    This interface should be implemented in order to store and fetch Configurations presented to Schedulers. In general a Configuration should describe the desired state of a Framework. They are referenced by their IDs. It can be determined whether a particular Task is up to date with a particular Configuration by reference to a Task label indicating its Configuration ID.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear(java.util.UUID id)
      Deletes the configuration with the provided UUID, or does nothing if no matching configuration is found.
      T fetch(java.util.UUID id, ConfigurationFactory<T> factory)
      Retrieves and deserializes the Configuration assigned to the provided UUID.
      java.util.UUID getTargetConfig()
      Returns the current ID of the active target configuration, or throws an exception if none is set.
      java.util.Collection<java.util.UUID> list()
      Returns a list of all stored configuration UUIDs, or an empty list if none are found.
      void setTargetConfig(java.util.UUID id)
      Stores the ID of the active target configuration, replacing any current value.
      java.util.UUID store(T config)
      Serializes the provided Configuration using its Configuration.getBytes() function, writes it to storage, and returns the UUID which it was stored against.

    • Method Detail

      • store

        java.util.UUID store(T config)
              throws ConfigStoreException
        Serializes the provided Configuration using its Configuration.getBytes() function, writes it to storage, and returns the UUID which it was stored against.
        Throws:
        ConfigStoreException - if serialization or writing fails

      • fetch

        T fetch(java.util.UUID id,
        ConfigurationFactory<T> factory)
 throws ConfigStoreException
        Retrieves and deserializes the Configuration assigned to the provided UUID.
        Parameters:
        id - The UUID of the configuration to be fetched
        factory - The deserializer implementation for the configuration data
        Returns:
        The deserialized configuration
        Throws:
        ConfigStoreException - if retrieval or deserialization fails

      • clear

        void clear(java.util.UUID id)
    throws ConfigStoreException
        Deletes the configuration with the provided UUID, or does nothing if no matching configuration is found.
        Parameters:
        id - The UUID of the configuration to be deleted
        Throws:
        ConfigStoreException - if the configuration is found but deletion fails

      • list

        java.util.Collection<java.util.UUID> list()
                                   throws ConfigStoreException
        Returns a list of all stored configuration UUIDs, or an empty list if none are found.
        Throws:
        ConfigStoreException - if list retrieval fails

      • setTargetConfig

        void setTargetConfig(java.util.UUID id)
              throws ConfigStoreException
        Stores the ID of the active target configuration, replacing any current value.
        Throws:
        ConfigStoreException - if writing the ID fails
        See Also:
        getTargetConfig()

      • getTargetConfig

        java.util.UUID getTargetConfig()
                        throws ConfigStoreException
        Returns the current ID of the active target configuration, or throws an exception if none is set.
        Throws:
        ConfigStoreException - if reading or deserializing the ID fails, or no value is set
        See Also:
        setTargetConfig(UUID)
